str2: (a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
I am acted upon in a certain way, either good or bad; I experience ill treatment, suffer.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Or prolonged paristano from para and histemi; to stand beside, i.e. to exhibit, proffer, recommend, substantiate; or to be at hand, aid.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: Himself, herself, itself.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: Who, which, what, that.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Much, many; often.
A sign, certain proof. Neuter of a presumed derivative of tekmar; a token, i.e. Criterion of certainty.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of the primary optomai; which is used for it in certain tenses; and both as alternate of horao; to gaze.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Forty. The decade of tessares; forty.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
